intro: Adeloda brachiata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep taproots to access water. Adeloda brachiata is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
